physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Patient was somewhat obese, agitated, restless; neurological examination revealed normal bilateral reflexes, normal speech, and no sensory disturbances.
Patient began to show superficial bodily bruises from falling and was mentally somewhat confused and disoriented; all deep reflexes were present but hypoactive.
Patient was flaccid, unable to move her arms and legs, with bilateral weakness of facial muscles. Deep and abdominal reflexes were unobtainable; responds to pain but not to light touch.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Patient’s condition worsened, showing complete flaccidity and inability to swallow.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Complete neurological examination showed flaccid paralysis of all extremities; no deep or superficial reflexes could be elicited.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Significant worsening with complete paralysis and elevated temperature.
